meanings.definition: Combining or alternating between tragedy and comedy.
meanings.sent1: The play had a tragicomical ending, leaving the audience both sad and happy.
meanings.sent2: Her tragicomical performance in the movie captured the essence of the storyline.
meanings.sent3: The tragicomical twist in the plot caught everyone off guard but made them chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Life can be a tragicomical journey, with unexpected turns of fate.
meanings.sent5: The tragicomical nature of the situation made it hard to know whether to laugh or cry.

meanings.definition: Having both tragic and comic elements.
meanings.sent1: The novel was a tragicomical masterpiece, blending sorrow and humor seamlessly.
meanings.sent2: His tragicomical expression showed a mix of sadness and amusement.
meanings.sent3: The tragicomical scene at the party had everyone in stitches.
meanings.sent4: Their relationship was a tragicomical dance of joy and sorrow.
meanings.sent5: The tragicomical nature of the story made it unforgettable and entertaining.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a mixture of tragedy and comedy.
meanings.sent1: The film's tragicomical tone resonated with viewers, evoking both tears and laughter.
meanings.sent2: The play was a tragicomical delight, keeping the audience engaged throughout.
meanings.sent3: The tragicomical atmosphere of the room lightened the mood instantly.
meanings.sent4: In a tragicomical turn of events, they found humor in the midst of despair.
meanings.sent5: The tragicomical elements of the story added depth and complexity to the characters.
